conclusion: Radar emits radio waves for 1 μs and interval between emissions is 100 μs; speed of light is 3.0 × 10^8 m/s.
Figure shows time intervals ab and bc are equal.
Time taken for radar wave to travel to obstacle and back is same for intervals ab and bc.
Total time for round trip of radar wave is 2 × ab.
Total time for one round trip is 100 μs.
One-way travel time is half of round trip time, t_one-way = 50 μs.
Convert 50 μs to seconds: 50 μs = 5 × 10^-5 s.
Calculate distance using d = c × t, d = 3.0 × 10^8 m/s × 5 × 10^-5 s.
Distance between obstacle and radar is 15,000 m or 15 km.
